required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study PIEB vs PIEB: the Dose is it Variable According to the Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Study Programmed Intermittent Epidural Bolus (PIEB) vs PIEB: the Dose is it Variable According to the Patients

brief_summary.textblock: the main objective of this study is to compare the effectiveness of three groups of epidurals with three different programmed intermittent epidural bolus (PIEB)settings.

detailed_description.textblock: In a PIEB, the concentration of local anesthetics administered is standardized in the services according to the recommendations. What is left to the judgement of the clinician, taking care of the patient during the work, is the administered dose. This often varies according to clinician deductions that take notice of height, weight, previous pregnancies In the CHU of Rennes, three dosages are used in common practice. The objective by comparing these three dosages is to show if there is a significant difference between the groups.

primary_outcome.measure: number of additional injections during work.

arm_group.description: Patients for whom the clinician has prescribed local anesthetics in the epidural: fixed dose administered every hour in a systematic way : 5 ml dose to be administered every hour by the patient : 5 ml

Patients for whom the clinician has prescribed local anesthetics in the epidural: fixed dose administered every hour in a systematic way : 6 ml dose to be administered every hour by the patient : 6 ml
Patients for whom the clinician has prescribed local anesthetics in the epidural: fixed dose administered every hour in a systematic way :7 ml dose to be administered every hour by the patient :7 ml

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant patient, during labor, for whom a PIEB is desired / programmed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient over 18 years old.
- Pregnant patient, during labor, live fetus, for whom a PIEB is desired / programmed.
- Patient not objecting to their participation in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hemostasis disorder contraindicated the epidural
- Eclampsia
- Caesarean section straightaway
- Patient under legal protection (guardianship, curatorship, safeguard of justice).
